I searched for information about Don Quixote's metafictional elements and their connection to modern narrative layers and self-referential techniques, particularly as they might relate to contemporary audiences like the TikTok generation.

Here are the key findings from the search:

## Don Quixote as a Pioneer of Metafiction

Cervantes created two new genres: realism and metafiction. Cervantes' novel is metafiction because it is fiction that raises questions about the nature of fiction itself and its "methods, procedures and assumptions."

## Multiple Narrative Layers

There are 3 worlds nested inside the novel. Each porous to one another. The first is the characters psychological interiority, Inside the world of the book, written by a fourth wall breaking self referential author.

## Self-Referential Elements

The novel contains remarkably modern self-referential techniques:

- In Part II, Chapter 62, the knight and his squire visit a printer's shop where publishers are producing an unauthorized sequel to El Ingenioso Hidalgo don Quixote de la Mancha. This ripoff gets a great deal of criticism from the characters, narrators and writers in Cervantes' second volume

- In Part 2 Don Quixote visits a printing-house in Barcelona and finds the unofficial sequel being printed there. The character of Quixote then proceeds to read a real book about himself. Which, from his point of view (and the authors) is a complete fabrication.

## Connection to Modern Audiences

This self-referential meta commentary, to the reader, still feels incredibly modern. The work anticipates contemporary concerns about media consumption and identity:

- A man who does nothing but read chivalric romances. Eventually, after collecting and consuming so many stories he loses his mind and decides to become a knight-errant himself... Brainworms; acquired from the media he was consuming – the world he was immersing himself in.

## Fan Fiction Parallels

To explain why, we must turn our minds to the modern phenomenon of fan fiction. Like fan fiction, Don Quixote is a work in dialogue with both reader and genre... Cervantes subverts both by having Quixote be a fan of the genre and operate by its conventions.

## Contemporary Relevance

It illustrates the evolving literary culture of the time. There was a growing awareness of the literary marketplace and economic value of creative work... Issues that in the age of AI, we are still wrestling with.

The search reveals that Don Quixote's sophisticated metafictional techniques - including nested narratives, self-referential commentary, and exploration of reality versus fiction - remain strikingly relevant to modern audiences, including the TikTok generation, who similarly navigate complex media landscapes and questions of authenticity.
